intro: Doxantha longisiliqua, commonly known as the long-silique dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble dandelion blooms. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces elongated, slender fruits called silique, which are typical of the Brassicaceae family. Doxantha longisiliqua is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats, thriving in temperate climates. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
